tweet_text: As a vaccine checker at an event, a couple asked me "vaccine for what" and I couldn't believe it.
The nurse allowed the person to use their own bandaid for the vaccine, but it didn't work out well.

My mom felt a greater appreciation for science after receiving her second vaccine shot.
A young ballet student asked if the person was excited about getting the COVID-19 vaccine, which they will now refer to as the "Fauci Ouchie."
Lindsey Graham got vaccinated before a nurse like me.

My 10-year-old child received the Pfizer vaccine and was nervous, but thought of his high-risk best friend throughout. I'm proud of him for doing it out of love.
Dolly Parton funded the development of the COVID vaccine, so please don't refuse to take it.

Explaining the science behind mRNA vaccines (like those from Pfizer and Moderna) which are considered brilliant, in a thread while waiting for a patient.
Myths about COVID-19: the virus will not go away in summer as previous pandemics didn't follow weather patterns, and with winter in the Southern Hemisphere, it's a global issue.
